msContents.summary: Scripture by various authors known as New Testament [n]

objectDesc.p: Papyrus, 17x13.5 (18x14), 4 extant leaf(s), 2 column(s), 36 line(s) per column, 12-18 characters per line, written in Greek.

handDesc.handNote: 150-199 Original scribe with professional hand (99 verses).

history.provenance: [1-4] Excavated 1889 at Qifṭ, Miṣr from a jar that had been walled up in a house.
[1-4] Purchased 1891 by Vincent Sheil at Al Uqşur, Miṣr.
[1-4] Transferred 1892 to Bibliothèque nationale de France (National Library of France) at Paris, France.

msIdentifier.msName: [1-4] Suppl. Gr. 1120, Bibliothèque nationale de France (National Library of France), Paris, France.

sourceDesc.bibl: Merell, J., “Nouveaux fragments papyrus IV”, Revue Biblique, no. 47, p. 5-22, Librairie Victor Lecoffre: Paris, France, 1938. OCLC 8461065.
